item.title: Batters, Asitha Fernando give Sri Lanka consolation win - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Sri Lanka Clinches Consolation Win Over New Zealand in Third ODI

Published on: Sat, Jan 11, 2025, 09:33 AM | Source: Cricbuzz

Sri Lanka gained a consolation win by clinching the third ODI against New Zealand by a massive margin of 140 runs, with significant contributions from batters and bowlers.

  • Sri Lanka set the highest score of the series, reaching 290 runs.
  • Asitha Fernando took three wickets in the powerplay, devastating New Zealand's batting lineup.
  • New Zealand struggled, collapsing to 21/5 early in their innings.
  • Mark Chapman scored a lone 81 runs but couldn't save the team from defeat.
  • Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka scored 66 runs, supported by Kusal Mendis and Janith Liyanage.
Brief Scores: Sri Lanka 290/8 (Pathum Nissanka 68, Kusal Mendis 54, Janith Liyanage 53; Matt Henry 4-55) beat New Zealand 150 all out (Mark Chapman 81; Asitha Fernando 3-26) by 140 runs

This win serves as a morale booster for Sri Lanka in their tour, showcasing their batting depth and bowling prowess.

item.title: BCCI Calls Meeting With Gautam Gambhir, Says Report. Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma May Be Given... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI Discusses Future of Kohli and Rohit in Upcoming Meeting

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The BCCI is set to hold a meeting with Gautam Gambhir and Chief Selector Ajit Agarkar to discuss the future of star players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma after recent disappointing performances in international cricket.

  • The upcoming meeting will review the recent tour to Australia and performances against New Zealand.
  • Concerns are growing about Kohli and Rohit's diminishing returns at the crease.
  • Selectors will also discuss team composition for the upcoming Champions Trophy in the UAE.
  • Questions remain over whether to transition younger players now or wait until after the next ICC event.
  • Kohli and Rohit's performances in the upcoming ODI Champions Trophy could be crucial for their futures.
"Both Kohli and Rohit have played just three ODIs in 2024 after the World Cup, which might be too light of a sample size to make a final call on their careers."

This meeting will also include a review of the Gamir-led coaching staff's performance and strategies moving forward.

item.title: Violence against minorities: Majority of incidents ‘political in nature’; ‘not communally motivated’: Bangladesh police report - The Hindu
item.description:
Violence against minorities: Majority of incidents ‘political in nature’; ‘not communally motivated’: Bangladesh police report

Published: January 11, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

Bangladesh police reported that a majority of violence against minorities has political motives rather than communal ones, amidst rising tensions following the departure of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

  • A total of 1,769 communal attacks were reported in August 2024.
  • Police classified 1,234 incidents as political and only 20 as communal.
  • 161 claims of violence were found to be false.
  • The interim government emphasizes zero tolerance against communal violence.
  • A compensation promise for victims of communal violence has been issued.
“In the majority of the cases, the attacks were not communally motivated – rather, those were political in nature.”

The report indicates a significant focus on addressing allegations and improving the safety of minority communities in Bangladesh.

item.title: India's Champions Trophy And England Series Squad Live: BCCI's Surprising Selection Message To KL Rahul - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India's Champions Trophy And England Series Squad Live: BCCI's Surprising Selection Message To KL Rahul

Publication Date: N/A Source: NDTV

This article discusses the unexpected decisions made by the BCCI regarding the selection of KL Rahul for the upcoming Champions Trophy and series against England.

  • The BCCI has taken surprising decisions in their squad selection for the Champions Trophy.
  • KL Rahul's inclusion has raised eyebrows given his recent form.
  • The article explores reactions from fans and cricket analysts regarding the selections.
  • Its impact on the team's strategy against England is also considered.
"The selection of KL Rahul has surprised many, considering the recent performance of other players."

The BCCI's choices reflect a mix of strategy and unpredictability, with significant implications for India's upcoming matches.

item.title: Six arrested after 18-year-old Dalit girl in Kerala alleges sexual abuse by 62 people over five years - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Six Arrested After Allegations of Sexual Abuse by 62 Individuals in Kerala

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Kerala Police have arrested six individuals after an 18-year-old Dalit girl alleged that she was sexually abused by 62 people over five years.

  • The allegations came to light when volunteers from the Kerala Mahila Samakhya Society met with the girl during a routine visit.
  • Two FIRs have been filed, and six people were arrested, with the investigation ongoing.
  • The girl has undergone counseling and disclosed her experiences to the Child Welfare Committee.
  • The abuse allegedly started when she was 13 years old.
“A deputy superintendent of police is leading the inquiry,” said Pathanamthitta Superintendent of Police, V G Vinod Kumar.

This case sheds light on the serious issue of sexual abuse and highlights the importance of support systems for survivors.

item.title: Tiku Talsania suffers massive heart attack, critical: reports - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Tiku Talsania suffers massive heart attack, critical: reports

Publication Date: N/A Source: Telly Chakkar

Tiku Talsania, renowned for his comedic roles in films like Andaz Apna Apna, has reportedly suffered a massive heart attack and is currently in critical condition at 70 years of age. Details about his condition remain scarce as of now.

  • Tiku Talsania has suffered a heart attack and is in critical condition.
  • He is known for his iconic roles in 1990s films.
  • No further details about his health have been released.
  • Talsania had previously shared insights about his experiences working with filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt.
“Tu bata camera kaha lagana hai?” (You tell me where to place the camera)

A memorable incident highlighted Talsania's experience under Mahesh Bhatt's direction, showcasing Bhatt's unique filmmaking style characterized by spontaneity and creativity.

In conclusion, Tiku Talsania's health condition raises concerns among fans and the film industry, marking a difficult moment for a beloved figure in Indian cinema.

item.title: Thousands of devotees flock to Ayodhya for Ram Lalla idol consecration anniversary - The Times of India
item.description:
Thousands of devotees flock to Ayodhya for Ram Lalla idol consecration anniversary

Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The anniversary of the Ram Lalla idol consecration has attracted thousands of devotees to Ayodhya, showcasing the significance of this event in the religious calendar.

  • Devotees gathered in large numbers to celebrate.
  • The event is a major religious occasion for Hindus.
  • Participants included families, children, and elderly individuals.
“The gathering signifies the deep faith and devotion of the believers,” said a local priest.

This celebration highlights the enduring spiritual and cultural relevance of Ayodhya in the Hindu community.

item.title: Aamir Khan quits smoking: When he said his cigarette smoke affected ex-wife Kiran Rao, but she wasn't ‘averse’ to pipe - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Aamir Khan Quits Smoking Ahead of Son's Film Release

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Aamir Khan announced on January 11, 2025, that he has quit smoking in preparation for his son Junaid Khan's film, Loveyapa. He explained that he has previously struggled with smoking but is committed to supporting his son during his career launch.

  • Aamir Khan recently quit smoking for his son's film release.
  • He had switched from cigarettes to pipe smoking a few years ago.
  • Kiran Rao, Aamir's ex-wife, was affected by his cigarette smoking but was not averse to pipe smoking.
  • Aamir has had a long history with smoking and has tried cigars but did not enjoy them.
  • He feels a personal sacrifice is needed as a father to support his son.
“I quit smoking for two-three years when I was training for Dhoom 3. But then, I went back to it again.” - Aamir Khan

Aamir Khan's decision to quit smoking reflects his desire to enhance his role as a father as his son begins his film career.

item.title: Game Changer Box Office Collections: Ram Charan and Shankar film underwhelms on first day in India - PINKVILLA
item.description:
Game Changer Box Office Collections: Ram Charan and Shankar film underwhelms on first day in India

Updated on Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Pinkvilla

Game Changer had a disappointing start at the Indian box office, collecting an approximate of Rs. 60 crore on its first day, which is considered underwhelming given the expectations set by its massive budget.

  • The film grossed Rs. 59.50 crore on its opening day.
  • Collections in Telugu states were below expectations, significantly lower than the targeted Rs. 60-65 crore.
  • The Hindi version performed the best with Rs. 7 crore NETT.
  • Low occupancy rates were observed with less than 50% in regular shows.
  • The performance was notably poor in Tamil Nadu and Kerala, traditionally strong markets for director Shankar.
“A little salt blends well with flour,” but here the salt is probably more than flour.

This lackluster performance raises questions about the film's future at the box office, given the high expectations set by its marketing and budget.

item.title: Assam reports first HMPV case this season as 10-month-old child tests positive in Dibrugarh - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Assam Reports First Case of HMPV Infection This Season

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Assam has reported its first case of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) infection this season, with a 10-month-old child testing positive. The infant is currently undergoing treatment at Assam Medical College and Hospital (AMCH) in Dibrugarh and is said to be stable.

  • Ten-month-old child tests positive for HMPV in Dibrugarh, Assam.
  • Child admitted to AMCH with cold-related symptoms four days ago.
  • HMPV infection confirmed by ICMR-RMRC Lahowal after routine tests.
  • HMPV is a common respiratory virus that usually causes mild symptoms.
  • Similar HMPV cases reported in Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu.
“The HMPV infection was confirmed yesterday after we got test results from Lahowal-based ICMR-RMRC. The child is stable now. It is a common virus, and there is nothing to worry about.” - Dr. Dhrubajyoti Bhuyan, AMCH superintendent

The detection of HMPV is not unusual, as the virus circulates seasonally and typically impacts infants and individuals with weaker immune systems more severely.

item.title: Game Changer worldwide box office collection day 1: Ram Charan film opens big, yet over ₹100 cr behind Pushpa 2 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Game Changer worldwide box office collection day 1: After earning over ₹50 crore domestically, the action entertainer earns more than thrice globally.

Date: Jan 11, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The film "Game Changer," directed by S Shankar and starring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, has made a spectacular opening at the box office with a worldwide collection of ₹186 crore on its first day. Despite this impressive debut, it trails significantly behind the blockbuster "Pushpa 2."

  • Game Changer earned ₹51.25 crore domestically on its opening day.
  • The film is set in the political landscape, following an IAS officer's struggle against corruption.
  • Pushpa 2 had an opening day collection of ₹294 crore, outpacing Game Changer by over ₹100 crore.
“The king's arrival is setting the box office ablaze. #GameChanger takes a blockbuster opening at the BOX OFFICE. GROSSES 186 CRORES WORLDWIDE on Day 1.”

In conclusion, while "Game Changer" shows strong numbers on its opening day, it has a long way to go to match the success of other major Telugu films such as "Pushpa 2."

item.title: Highlights | HMPV Cases in India: Total Case Count Increases To 13, 2 New HMPV Virus Reported; Check - Zee News
item.description:
HMPV Cases in India Rise to 13

Publication Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: Zee News

The number of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) cases in India has increased to 13, raising concerns about a potential outbreak during the Mahakumbh festival, with millions expected to attend.

  • Current reported cases include two in Bengaluru, one in Gujarat, two in Chennai, three in Kolkata, two in Nagpur, and one in Mumbai.
  • HMPV, identified in 2001, has been circulating globally and is linked to respiratory infections.
  • An 80-year-old man's hospitalization due to HMPV symptoms was confirmed positive.
  • The Health Ministry reassures that they are prepared to handle any surge in respiratory illnesses.
  • Costs for HMPV RT-PCR testing range from Rs 3,000 to Rs 8,000, with comprehensive tests up to Rs 20,000.
“HMPV is not a new virus; it has been circulating globally for many years,” said Union Health Minister JP Nadda.

As the festival approaches, health officials are closely monitoring the situation to prevent any major health risks.

item.title: Congress's ‘damage control’ dig at PM Narendra Modi's ‘I am not a God’ comment in Nikhil Kamath's podcast - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Congress Critiques PM Modi's Podcast Remarks on Being Human

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent podcast, PM Narendra Modi stated that he is human and can make mistakes, a claim met with skepticism from Congress leader Jairam Ramesh, who accused the Prime Minister of engaging in damage control due to his previous assertion of being 'non-biological'.

  • Modi acknowledged his humanity and capacity for mistakes during a podcast with Nikhil Kamath.
  • Ramesh's critique refers to Modi's earlier statement on his 'non-biological' status made just months prior.
  • Modi emphasized the need for idealism in politics over strict ideological adherence.
“This from a man who proclaimed his non-biological status just eight months back. This is clearly damage control.” - Jairam Ramesh

The exchange highlights ongoing tensions between Congress and the ruling party regarding Modi's leadership narrative.

item.title: 6 benefits of eating 2 dates every day - The Times of India
item.description:
6 Benefits of Eating 2 Dates Every Day

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

A brief overview of the health benefits derived from consuming two dates daily. This article explores the nutritional advantages and potential health improvements associated with this practice.

  • Boosts energy levels
  • Improves digestion
  • Enhances heart health
  • Provides essential nutrients
  • Supports brain health
  • Assists in weight management
“Dates are rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals that contribute to overall health.”

In conclusion, incorporating two dates into your daily diet can offer numerous health benefits that promote overall well-being.

item.title: BCCI Takes Shock U-Turn On KL Rahul Selection In India Squad For England ODIs: Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI Takes Shock U-Turn On KL Rahul Selection In India Squad For England ODIs: Report

Date: 11 January 2025Source: NDTV

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has reversed its decision regarding KL Rahul's participation in the upcoming ODI series against England. Initially resting him, the board has now requested his availability as they aim to provide him with match practice ahead of the Champions Trophy in February.

  • BCCI had initially agreed to KL Rahul's break from the ODI assignment.
  • Recent developments show the board now wants him available for selection.
  • Rahul's performance in the Test series in Australia was notable, being the third-highest run-getter for India.
  • Competition for the wicketkeeper batter's slot includes Rishabh Pant and Sanju Samson.
  • The board is seeking an extension from the ICC for the Champions Trophy squad announcement.
“The selectors initially decided to rest Rahul… However, they had a rethink and the BCCI has now asked him to play…”

This change signifies the BCCI's emphasis on Rahul's performance potential and readiness for future tournaments, demonstrating a dynamic approach to player management.

item.title: Indian economy likely to be 'a little weaker' in 2025: IMF MD - Moneycontrol
item.description:
IMF Projects Slight Weakness in Indian Economy for 2025

Date: January 11, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian economy is expected to be "a little weaker" in 2025, as per IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva, who attributes this forecast to uncertainty in global trade policies, particularly from the US.

  • IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva stated the Indian economy's anticipated weakness despite global growth.
  • Concerns raised about regional divergence in economic performance globally.
  • Georgieva cited rising long-term interest rates as a global challenge.
  • The US economy is performing better than earlier projections, while the EU is experiencing stagnation.
"The US is doing quite a bit better than we expected before, the EU is somewhat stalling, (and) India a little weaker," said Kristalina Georgieva.

Moving forward, details regarding the Indian economy's trajectory will be further elaborated during the upcoming World Economy Outlook update week.

item.title: Henry and Co restrict SL to 290 despite Nissanka, Kusal fifties - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Henry and Co restrict SL to 290 despite Nissanka, Kusal fifties

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: ESPNcricinfo

In a tightly contested ODI, Sri Lanka managed to score 290 for 8 thanks to Pathum Nissanka and Kusal Mendis, who both achieved rapid fifties. Despite a middle-order slowdown, Janith Liyanage's steady batting helped Sri Lanka post a competitive total against New Zealand.

  • Sri Lanka scored 290 for 8 in their innings, with Nissanka (66), Kusal (54), and Liyanage (53) being the top scorers.
  • New Zealand's Matt Henry took 4 wickets for 55 runs, leading the bowling attack.
  • The innings saw a middle-order collapse as New Zealand's spinners applied pressure.
  • Nissanka retired hurt due to a hamstring strain but returned to contribute to the total.
  • Sri Lanka scored 53 runs in the last six overs, attacking aggressively towards the end.
"Sri Lanka had been coasting on 155 for 1 after 27 overs... but New Zealand's spinners stemmed the flow of runs."

New Zealand's disciplined bowling showcased their ability to capitalize on mistakes, while Sri Lanka's batting depth was tested throughout the innings, suggesting a competitive chase ahead.
